intro: Balendasia, commonly known as the "devil's backbone," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. These plants are native to tropical regions of Africa and are characterized by their striking, often brightly colored flowers. Balendasia species typically have square stems and opposite leaves, which are typical features of the Acanthaceae family. They are often grown as ornamental plants due to their vibrant blooms and unique foliage. Some species are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
